Posts.Content: On 6/26/2008 Kittycath wrote: I am thrilled to report that I am going to be taking my last tomaxifen in mid- August.  With family and firends we are having a PINK PARTY and I will take that last pill served on a silver platter and down it with pink champagne; everyone is going to wer pink--I am SO excited.  But--on to my questions.  I have read things here and there that soy is a No-No for breast cancer gals.  How dangerous is it to use soy?  I have put whey protein in my morning oatmeal for a couple of years, but it seems I may be having some difficulties eating so much dairy.  So, I have wondered if it would be dangerous to use soy protein instead of whey.  I use the protein powder because I am not much of a meat eater.  Also, what about body lotions containing soy (that certainly has become a trend).  Finally, what about soy "milk" like SILK?  Any nutritionists out there that can help with this? First of all Kittycath let me say congratulations on being able to end taking tamoxifen. Excellent news and deserving of a great celebration. What better way to celebrate than to have a party with the the friends and family that have been such a good support system for you. I like the idea of the pill on a silver platter and washing it down with pink champagne. Sounds like your strong sense of humor has been good medicine to help you through this too. On to the soy question. I personally use almond milk which comes in natural, vanilla and chocolate. All delicious in my opinion. Because I stay away from sugar as much as I possibly can I prefer the natural and then I sweeten it with Stevia. For extra protein it was recommended I use a protein powder based on brown rice. Here's some info on the almond milk. If it should be removed because of the mention of the brand please send me a private message and I'll send the info that way. http://www.bluediamond.com/almonds/nutrition/index.cfm?l_tab Have fun at the PINK PARTY!!!!!
Posts.Title: SOY and breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hello Ann2112____I couldn't agree with you more about the power of the mind. Since my diagnosis I have used visualization techniques which I learned from a young energy healer. He teaches at workshops and his "students" are having amazing results with a variety of health issues. There are many cancer hospitals that offer complementary and alternative treatments along with the traditional ones that are now teaching these techniques to their patients as well. We are what we think! On 12/15/2007 Ann2112 wrote: I understand being so scared, I just had a lumpectomy and sentinal lymph biop. on thurs.  Waiting for Path results and I'm only 40 years old!  Yikes.   But my advice may not be what you need, I am not a doctor and have a elementary Cancer education.  So take this for what it is worth.  What I do know thanks to an old soul and really smart folks, is that our minds are so powerful.  We can think our way into symptoms and moods very easily.  Have you ever been depressed for awhile and caught a flu?  Think they may have been related?  What I have been doing since I was diagnosed is mainly spiritual.  I bought a couple Vegetarian cook books and improved my diet, started yoga, I meditate when I can, listen to music I love, and I stay informed about cancer and how it works.  A great book " Dr. Susan Love's Breast Book" has helped me.  Also I learned from a friend in the Med. Industry, If you have certain PPO/HMO Insurance you are eligible for an AB12 coverage. In which, and free of cost, allows you a 2nd opinion at University level and higher Cancer research hospitals.  Your Insurance company may not be eager to tell you about this for economic reasons to themselves.  All of these things I mentioned are jsut personal experience, but with love, I hope something is usful to you.  Worth looking into maybe.

Posts.Content: Hello Grace234 The medical/alternative doctor that I see specializes in natural treatments for cancers of all types. He has had some amazing results and one young lady that I have come to know personally there who presented with estrogen positive breast cancer has been taking Intravenous Vitamin C treatments and Avemar was highly recommended for her particular case as well. Her latest scans showed regression in her tumors and she is feeling strong and energetic. If you could find a medical doctor who specializes in alternative medicine or a naturopath they would offer these treatments. Unfortunately there are not many traditional allopathic doctors on board yet except for an enlightened few. Most discourage anything natural. Here are a few websites with information that might be helpful ________Intravenous Vitamin C_____ http://www.medpagetoday.com/HematologyOncology/OtherCancers/ http://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/30584.php http://www.alternativehealth.co.nz/cancer/vitamins/vitc.htm http://orthomolecular.org/resources/omns/v01n09.shtml http://www.doctoryourself.com/riordan1.htm ________Avemar______ http://www.cancercompass.com/cancer-news/1,12705,00.htm Copyright (C) 2007 PR Newswire. All Rights Reserved In clinical cancer trials, Avemar was shown to reduce the progression of disease in patients with head and neck cancers, colorectal cancer, and malignant melanoma of the skin. The quality of life of patients with breast cancer or lung cancer improved significantly (P < 0.05) after supportive treatment with Avemar: improvements in the global state of health and fatigue were observed in lung cancer patients, and improvements in physical and emotional function, the global state of health, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, insomnia, and constipation were observed in breast cancer patients. Clinical studies of the efficacy of Avemar in the treatment of other cancers are ongoing. However, observational data indicate that this wheat germ extract has favorable effects on ovarian cancer, gastric cancer, thyroid cancer, non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, and multiple myeloma. "The therapeutic spectrum of Avemar is much wider than it had been thought some years ago." Avemar (Wheat Germ Extract) Avemar is the new wonder-alternative cancer treatment / adjuvant therapy for boosting the immune system and fighting cancer. "Research at UCLA has demonstrated that Avemar reduces glucose flow into the cancer cells.  Cancer cells can evade NK [natural killer] cells by masking their outer membrane with a special substance that the NK cells recognize as 'normal.'  Avemar suppresses the release of this masking substance -- allowing NK cells to better target and kill the cancer cells."  Avemar's immune-stimulating ability appears to be so powerful that it can be useful in helping to restore even the most severely compromised immune systems. Posts.Content: Arimidex side effects http://breast-cancer.emedtv.com/arimidex/arimidex-side-effec   The Cancer Compass Newsletter contained the following information some time ago but the link to it has expired.  I found the identical information on the American Society for Clinical Oncology webiste and I hope it is helpful for all of you.  If you do a Google search on Avemar you will find many clinical trials which show it's efficacy in treating many types of cancer. "June 4, 2007 - A fermented wheat germ extract inhibits estrogen positive and estrogen negative breast cancer tumors better than the world’s best selling cancer drug, Tamoxifen, according to research published this past weekend at the 2007 meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology, ASCO.  The compound, Avemar, has been extensively studied in many cell lines, animal tumor models, and several human clinical trials. In the current study, András Telekes, MD, Ph.D., head physician at the Hungarian National Institute of Oncology, and colleagues, implanted estrogen receptor-positive  (ER+) and estrogen receptor-negative (ER-) breast tumors from humans and mouse cell lines into female mice and monitored tumor growth. They compared tumor growth in mice treated with Avemar alone, or treated with three of the most widely used and studied breast cancer drugs: Tamoxifen, Aromasin, or Arimidex, alone, and combinations of those drugs with Avemar. Against the mouse ER+ cell line, MXT, Avemar inhibited growth by 50%, Aromasin by 46.7%, Tamoxifen by 34% and Arimidex by 29.3%.  Against the human ER+ cell line, T47T, Avemar inhibited growth by 49%, Tamoxifen 42%, Aromasin 25% and Arimidex 25%.  Each agent was enhanced by 5 to 10% when combined with Avemar. Most effective was a combination of Aromasin and Avemar, inhibiting both the mouse and human derived ER+ breast tumors by 60%. Effects against estrogen receptor-negative (ER-) breast cancer were measured with the human derived, MDA-MB-231 cell line.  Estrogen-blocking drugs are not effective against ER- breast cancers, so they were not tested in this tumor model.  However, Avemar did inhibit the growth of the ER-negative MDA-MB-231 breast tumors significantly (52%), suggesting to researchers that the mechanism by which the extract works is different from that of the anti-estrogen drugs, and is independent of a breast tumor's estrogen receptor status.    Avemar's efficacy against both ER+ and ER- tumor types suggests the compound's mechanisms of action against breast cancer may be those that inhibited tumor growth in other cancers, including lung, pancreatic, colon, melanoma, leukemia, and other breast cancer lines, among others, against which the compound has also been tested. Chief among these mechanisms is its ability to interfere with the excess use of glucose by cancer cells (the Warburg effect), which interferes with the synthesis of DNA needed for cell proliferation. Avemar is produced by Biromedicina, RT of Budapest, Hungary through a patented process (US no. 6,355,474) and standardized for content of methoxy-substituted benzoquinones. The Hungarian Ministry of Health has approved Avemar as a “medical food,” with an on-label indication in the treatment of colorectal and other cancers. Avemar, distributed by Blauvelt, NY American BioSciences in the US as the dietary supplement Avé, is available nationwide through vitamin retailers, doctors, pharmacies. Avemar research is available via the National Library of Medicine website, www.pubmed.gov using the search term Avemar.  http://www.npicenter.com/article/Research/Wheat-Germ-Extract

PLS CAN ANYONE TELL ME IF THEY TOO HAVE HAD THIS EFFECT FROM tamoxifen/arimidex.  I dont know what to do.  I know this is my life and I shouldn't go off it as my life is more important than my hair, but my daily life and how i feel about myself is just as important.. I just need a dr, anyone, who can tell me if they think this is meds.. and given my case, would it be safe to go off now...   someone told me if i've gone over 4 yrs, the meds have done what they are supposed to, but yet 5 yrs is the norm... pls can someone help me. this has ruined my life, i'm seeing a therapist monthly, on anti depressants, etc....  i truly believe going off meds would give me some relief to see if it will improve.. PLS PLS PLS HELP ME.. I have even considered a transplant and I dont know what to do... PLS help me. someone... It would probably be worth your while to do some research on Alternative treatments for cancer. Try to find a qualified naturopath or homeopathic doctor in your area who could work with you on restoring your health through natural means. It IS possible to beat cancer without chemo. All the best Shemay

I will take my tamoxifen  for the next five years, thanking the Lord that I did not need radiation or chemo. Posts.Content: Hi Femesoule......I found your message very interesting as I too opted out of all traditional treatments in favor of alternative. That was in early 2004 and I continue to feel strong and healthy A complemtary doctor discovered recently that my inflammation level was 57 when acceptable is anything under 5. I took some Intravenous Vitamin C treatments and now the level is normal. It might be worth you investigating since as you know high inflammation can cause many problems, some very serious. That dark field microscopy is fascinating. It's a really good eye opener when one can see their own red and white blood cells and also the debris in the blood that the whites have to deal with. One day when my husband was having his blood checked this way, he had lots of "oil" floating about so the Naturopath asked him what he'd had for breakfast. His reply was....a banana. Well of course this would not cause "oil" to be floating about so I asked him what he'd had at the coffee shop before our trip to the clinic. His answer......coffee with double cream and a doughnut. He became very aware at that moment the connection between what we eat and the stresses that can be caused in the body because of poor choices. Sounds like you are on a very good path for yourself. I wish you continued good health. Shemay On 5/4/2007 Femesoule wrote: I opted out of 18 months of radiation and chemo after a lumpectomy.  My physician did not get clean margins and I opted out of a second surgery.  I went to a health institute instead. I did go off of my raw food diet which I went on at the health institute for awhile.  The cancer returned.  Again, I opted out of surgery and purchase a low level light laser.  I am using the laser daily and it seems to be helping.  I know that my immune system is not that great.  My red blood cells are clumped together and there is inflamation in my blood.  I learned this by having a Microscopic Darkfied Live Blood Test. I have suffered from a low evergy level all of my life.  I am a widow and live by myself.  I do not think that I could go through more fatique alone.  I also get the cancer magazine "Cure."  After, reading the side affects even of radiation, it does not motivate me to do it.  I am doing everything that I can with alternatives.  I am 70 years old and feel great and do not look my age.  I want my last years to be happy even if I should pass on sooner.  Yvonne

Posts.Content: http://www.npicenter.com/article/Research/Wheat-Germ-Extract A fermented wheat germ extract inhibits estrogen positive and estrogen negative breast cancer tumors better than the world’s best selling cancer drug, Tamoxifen, according to research published this past weekend at the 2007 meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology, ASCO.  The compound, Avemar, has been extensively studied in many cell lines, animal tumor models, and several human clinical trials. In the current study, András Telekes, MD, Ph.D., head physician at the Hungarian National Institute of Oncology, and colleagues, implanted estrogen receptor-positive  (ER+) and estrogen receptor-negative (ER-) breast tumors from humans and mouse cell lines into female mice and monitored tumor growth. They compared tumor growth in mice treated with Avemar alone, or treated with three of the most widely used and studied breast cancer drugs: Tamoxifen, Aromasin, or Arimidex, alone, and combinations of those drugs with Avemar. Against the mouse ER+ cell line, MXT, Avemar inhibited growth by 50%, Aromasin by 46.7%, Tamoxifen by 34% and Arimidex by 29.3%.  Against the human ER+ cell line, T47T, Avemar inhibited growth by 49%, Tamoxifen 42%, Aromasin 25% and Arimidex 25%.  Each agent was enhanced by 5 to 10% when combined with Avemar. Most effective was a combination of Aromasin and Avemar, inhibiting both the mouse and human derived ER+ breast tumors by 60%. Effects against estrogen receptor-negative (ER-) breast cancer were measured with the human derived, MDA-MB-231 cell line.  Estrogen-blocking drugs are not effective against ER- breast cancers, so they were not tested in this tumor model.  However, Avemar did inhibit the growth of the ER-negative MDA-MB-231 breast tumors significantly (52%), suggesting to researchers that the mechanism by which the extract works is different from that of the anti-estrogen drugs, and is independent of a breast tumor's estrogen receptor status.    Avemar's efficacy against both ER+ and ER- tumor types suggests the compound's mechanisms of action against breast cancer may be those that inhibited tumor growth in other cancers, including lung, pancreatic, colon, melanoma, leukemia, and other breast cancer lines, among others, against which the compound has also been tested. Chief among these mechanisms is its ability to interfere with the excess use of glucose by cancer cells (the Warburg effect), which interferes with the synthesis of DNA needed for cell proliferation. Avemar is produced by Biromedicina, RT of Budapest, Hungary through a patented process (US no. 6,355,474) and standardized for content of methoxy-substituted benzoquinones. The Hungarian Ministry of Health has approved Avemar as a “medical food,” with an on-label indication in the treatment of colorectal and other cancers. Avemar, distributed by Blauvelt, NY American BioSciences in the US as the dietary supplement Avé, is available nationwide through vitamin retailers, doctors, pharmacies. Avemar research is available via the National Library of Medicine website, www.pubmed.gov using the search term Avemar. Additional product information is available from American BioSciences, 888-884-7770, www.americanbiosciences.com If one reads carefully the scientific papers, it soon becomes clear that Avemar's anti-tumor and anti-metastasis capabilities do not depend, to any degree, on being supported by chemotherapy or radiation treatments. Quite the opposite. It can be strongly argued that such toxic treatments will neutralize the beneficial effects of Avemar. Of course, the new product had to play a submissive role to the official toxic protocols in order to be accepted by the medical establishment. http://www.holisticcancersolutions.com/avemar_report.htm

Posts.Content: DANGERS OF SCREENING MAMMOGRAPHY Mammography poses a wide range of risks of which women worldwide still remain uninformed. Radiation Risks Radiation from routine mammography poses significant cumulative risks of initiating and promoting breast cancer (1- 3). Contrary to conventional assurances that radiation exposure from mammography is trivial- and similar to that from a chest X-ray or spending one week in Denver, about 1/ 1,000 of a rad (radiation-absorbed dose)- the routine practice of taking four films for each breast results in some 1,000-fold greater exposure, 1 rad, focused on each breast rather than the entire chest (2). Thus, premenopausal women undergoing annual screening over a ten-year period are exposed to a total of about 10 rads for each breast. As emphasized some three decades ago, the premenopausal breast is highly sensitive to radiation, each rad of exposure increasing breast cancer risk by 1 percent, resulting in a cumulative 10 percent increased risk over ten years of premenopausal screening, usually from ages 40 to 50 (4); risks are even greater for "baseline" screening at younger ages, for which there is no evidence of any future relevance. Furthermore, breast cancer risks from mammography are up to fourfold higher for the 1 to 2 percent of women who are silent carriers of the A-T (ataxia-telangiectasia) gene and thus highly sensitive to the carcinogenic effects of radiation (5); by some estimates this accounts for up to 20 percent of all breast cancers annually in the United States (6). Cancer Risks from Breast Compression As early as 1928, physicians were warned to handle "cancerous breasts with care- for fear of accidentally disseminating cells" and spreading cancer (7). Nevertheless, mammography entails tight and often painful compression of the breast, particularly in premenopausal women. This may lead to distant and lethal spread of malignant cells by rupturing small blood vessels in or around small, as yet undetected breast cancers (8). If you would like to read the full text on this issue please send me a private message as the website will be disallowed on this board.

Posts.Content: Personally I think it is very unfortunate that people close their minds to the possibilities of natural healing.  I chose to forgo the traditional treatment that was recommended for me to "perhaps save myself" when I was diagnosed in early 2004 with non Hodgkin's. A malignant lymph node on my heart, a huge tumor in my chest cavity and smaller tumours in both lungs were all inoperable.  R/CHOP was recommended but I chose instead to work with a reputable Naturopath and Medical Doctor who specializes in treating cancers alternatively.   Through diet, supplements and treatments such as intravenous vitamin c, low dose naltrexone/alpha lipoic acid, Avemar etc I recovered quickly and remain symptom free six years later.     I've posted the story on the prostate cancer board of a friend of mine who was declared terminal with less than a month to live in December 2006. He had mets to every organ and bone in his body from his groin to his head.  PSA was over 4,000.  After just three months of weekly intravenous vitamin c treatments and one 20 day course of daily injections of 714X he recovered fully and there was still no evidence of disease when I talked with him earlier this year.   I still take maintenance intravenous C treatments every six weeks or so and continue to see and hear many success stories from other patients many who were declared terminal after undergoing all that traditional medicine had to offer them.   Nothing that we take or do is harmful in any way and so it is beyond my comprehension why some  are so against trying something that is not only gentle with no negative side effects but also can be low cost and most importantly has been proven effective in actual verified cases.   As you can see in the following information  apricot  pits contain BENZALDEHYDE which was found to be very effective in the trial described in the PubMed link.   APRICOT PITS  The almond is closely related to the peach, apricot, and cherry (all classified as drupes). Unlike the others, however, the outer layer of the almond is not edible. The edible portion of the almond is the seed. A compound called amygdalin differentiates the bitter almond from the sweet almond. In the presence of water (hydrolysis), amygdalin yields glucose and the chemicals benzaldehyde and hydrocyanic acid (HCN). HCN, the salts of which are known as cyanide, is poisonous. To be used in food or as a flavoring agent, the HCN must be removed from the bitter almond oil. Once it is removed, the oil is called volatile almond oil and is considered to be almost pure BENZALDEHYDE. Volatile almond oil can still be toxic in large amounts. Antitumor activity of benzaldehyde. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/6929727?dopt=Abstract   Ninety patients with inoperable carcinoma in the terminal stages and 12 patients in serious condition with other tumor types were given benzaldehyde in the form of beta-cyclodextrin benzaldehyde inclusion compound (CDBA) orally or rectally at a daily dose of 10 mg/kg divided in four doses. Toxic effects, including hematologic or biochemical disturbances, were not seen during long-term successive administration of CDBA. Fifty-seven of the patients treated were evaluable; 19 patients responded completely and ten patients responded partially (greater than 50% regression). For all responding patients longer response durations were associated with longer CDBA treatment periods. Treatment of squamous cell carcinoma induced the cancer cells to change into a conglomeration of pearls (the well-known product of differentiation) which consisted of keratinized normal squamous cells." PMID: 6929727 [PubMed - indexed for MEDLINE]   We all need to do our own indepth  research and not just listen to the Pharma backed Quackbusters.

As I said, fascinating. Shows us we have so much to learn. Blessings to you too Moon Masque.

Posts.Content: Lymph Node Study Shakes Pillar of Breast Cancer Care A new study finds that many women with early breast cancer do not need a painful procedure that has long been routine: removal of cancerous lymph nodes from the armpit. The discovery turns standard medical practice on its head. Surgeons have been removing lymph nodes from under the arms of breast cancer patients for 100 years, believing it would prolong women’s lives by keeping the cancer from spreading or coming back. For more information: http://www.nytimes.com/2011/02/09/health/research/09breast.h

It is time women took some responsibility for their own health without acting like little robots.  Conventional doctors are bound to pharmaceutical companies and insurance companies and what they prescribe.  Doctors are not even allowed to tell you if there is alternative treatment.  They can only provide surgery, radiation/chemotherapy and drugs.  These drugs will need other drugs to counteract the side effects of the first drug.  The older you get the worse the cycle. I love my doctor, but I do my homework.  He thinks I am going to try one of the other drugs when I am totally post menopausel, but he is wrong. I was 49 when diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma with a micromet in one lymph node.  I had a lumpectomy and then a mastectomy with reconstruction.  He said chemo would only have added 1-2% toward my nonrecurrance rate and said it wasn't worth the horror.  I am currently looking for some way to prevent the night time hot flashes that wake me up every 1-2 hours all night long.  I am currently using the progesterone cream and taking an Estroven.  Sleeping pills don't help much and they have lousy side effects.  Anybody got a natural suggestion that has worked for them?
Posts.Title: Armimidex and side effects

Posts.Content: No Avemar is not prescription. It is a natural substance. I get mine from the clinic I go to. It is rather expensive. I pay 150.00 (Canadian) for a months supply. I do believe you can buy it online though. There was a message posted on this board a short time ago with good information about a reliable source but I'm sorry I didn't make note of it. On 1/16/2008 2008info wrote: Thanks for the info. I went to the websit from the link you posted here and I was impressed by Avemar's efficacy. Is Avemar a prescription medicine? Where can you buy it?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen?

Posts.Content: Here is a website with information regarding a completely natural substance which has been proven through clinical trials to be more effective than Tamoxifen. It is also a very effective treatment for other cancers as well. I have used it personally and experienced absolutely no negative side effects. http://www.cancercompass.com/cancer-news/1,12705,00.htm On 1/14/2008 2008info wrote: Hi everyone, Can anyone give me any suggestion on whether taking Tamoxifen or any other drugs after mastectomy? I had mastectomy surgery four months ago since I had ductal carcinoma in situ(DCIS, stage o breast cancer). After the surgery, I went to see an oncologist. The oncologist suggested me to take tamoxifen for five years. And I was told about the side effects of may getting uterine cancer. I'm still hesitating to take tamoxifen. But I'm scared of the recurrence of the bc. Does anyone have the same situation as mine? What should I do? Any input would be greately appreciated.
